items.q: Which of these is a brass instrument?
items.explanation: The trumpet is made of brass and requires the player to buzz their lips into a mouthpiece.

items.q: A drum set is considered a percussion instrument.
items.explanation: Percussion instruments are typically sounded by being struck, scraped, or rubbed by hand or against another similar instrument.

items.q: In sheet music, a whole note is held for exactly one beat.
items.explanation: In common time (4/4), a whole note is held for four beats.

items.a: A duet is a musical composition or performance involving exactly two singers or instrumentalists.
items.explanation: Both performers generally have equal importance in the piece.

items.q: Describe the function of a metronome.
items.a: A metronome gives a steady beat or click to help a musician keep a consistent tempo while practicing.
items.explanation: It can be set to different speeds (beats per minute).

items.a: A composer writes and creates original musical pieces.
items.explanation: They arrange the notes, melodies, and harmonies that make up a song or symphony.

items.q: Name the famous instrument that is played by drawing a bow across its strings and is tucked under the chin.
items.explanation: It is the highest-pitched member of the string family in an orchestra.

items.q: What is country music known for in terms of its lyrics?
items.a: Country music often tells a story, frequently focusing on themes of rural life, love, heartbreak, and everyday struggles.
items.explanation: It also heavily features instruments like the acoustic guitar, fiddle, and steel guitar.

items.q: What is a chorus in a popular song?
items.a: The chorus is the repeating section of a song that usually contains the main theme and catchiest melody.
items.explanation: It serves as the focal point that listeners easily remember and sing along to.

items.q: Which British band famously included members John, Paul, George, and Ringo?
items.explanation: They remain one of the most influential and successful bands in history.
